title: 30 Slip Dresses That Will Anchor Your Wardrobe for Years to Come
description: The '90s icon is here to stay.
excerpt: The '90s icon is here to stay.
text: It’s been decades since Kate Moss, Courtney Love, and Carrie Bradshaw elevated the humble slip dress to It-girl status, yet the iconic ’90s style remains a modern wardrobe staple. Little wonder the one-and-done silhouette has stuck around so long: Cut on the bias (fashion speak for a 45° angle), slips drape over the body in a way that’s both effortlessly sexy and surprisingly comfortable. Once considered too risqué to wear outside the house, slinky little numbers can now be sported at work, weddings, and far beyond. To help you find the perfect one, we’ve highlighted six key types of slip dresses below—though it’s worth making room in your closet for multiple options.The Keep-Forever LBDThe black slip dress is so classic, fashion editors rank them right alongside white tees and Levi’s 501s. Versatile enough to pair with practically anything, a timeless LBD slip makes a chic complement to trending items like ballerina sneakers, barn jackets, and studded hobo bags. Snag one now from Lunya, Skims, or Leset, so you’ll be ready to style whatever It-pieces the coming seasons bring. Lunya Washable Silk Slip DressLeset Barb Satin Slip DressSkims Soft Lounge Long Slip DressNorma Kamali Satin Bias Strapless GownNow 7% OffCou Cou The Cami SlipThe Personality PrintSlip dresses may be defined by their simplicity, but that doesn’t mean they have to be boring. The understated, spaghetti-strap silhouette makes the perfect canvas for a conversation-starting print. Whether Leslie Amon’s chili-peppered LBD or the colorful lemon midi from L’Agence speaks more to your personal style, you’ll find an excuse to show off your new favorite dress again and again.Leslie Amon Spicy Galli Mini DressHutch Emaline Satin Maxi SlipdressNow 37% OffMiaou Helga DressSilk Laundry ’90s Slip DressL'Agence Akiya Tank DressThe Wedding Guest DressClassically sexy and effortlessly chic, an ankle-skimming slip dress can outsmart any wedding dress code. A change of shoes and accessories completely transforms a look, meaning you can rewear the same dress to a gala or cocktail party happening later in the year. Thankfully, Nili Lotan’s silk charmeuse gown and Meshki’s butter yellow maxi work just as well for garden parties as they do black-tie affairs. Nili Lotan Cami Silk Charmeuse GownMango Draped Dress With Flower DetailMeshki Yvette Slip Maxi DressStaud Cadence Satin Maxi DressVince Satin Bias Maxi Slip DressThe Linen Summer DressMadewell, Favorite Daughter, and Banana Republic’s linen slip dresses will be among the first items you reach for when temperatures peak and vacation calls. The body-skimming tank silhouette keeps you cool and comfortable, and it pairs effortlessly with flip-flops, raffia bags, shell necklaces, and other beachy accoutrements.Madewell Scoopneck Linen Midi DressFavorite Daughter The Josette Linen Slip DressBanana Republic Draped Viscose-Linen Maxi DressReiss Roxanne Linen Slip DressJ.Crew Lace-Trim Linen Slip DressThe Lingerie SlipLean into the slip’s boudoir origins with a lacy, lingerie-inspired dress that gives you an instant confidence boost. Reformation, Dôen, and LoveShackFancy’s flirty little numbers can slant ’90s grunge or 21st-century boho depending on how they’re styled. They also happen to make excelllent date-night dresses. Mango Lace Camisole DressReformation Cleodora DressDôen Alissa DressMassimo Dutti Satin Camisole Midi DressLoveShackFancy Manuela DressThe Sleek Wardrobe StapleA neutral-colored slip dress can be a versatile staple in your everyday wardrobe. Éterne, Naadam, and Another Tomorrow’s understated midis and maxis can be layered over a fitted tee or slipped beneath a blazer. And they look just as good with Sambas as they do with chunky fisherman sandals, strappy high heels, and demure ballet flats.Éterne Maxi Tank DressNaadam Baby Rib Slip DressCuyana Crepe De Chine Silk Slip DressNow 39% OffAya Muse Jersey Slip DressAnother Tomorrow Square Neck Slip Dress
html:
It’s been decades since Kate Moss, Courtney Love, and Carrie Bradshaw elevated the humble slip dress to It-girl status, yet the iconic ’90s style remains a modern wardrobe staple. Little wonder the one-and-done silhouette has stuck around so long: Cut on the bias (fashion speak for a 45° angle), slips drape over the body in a way that’s both effortlessly sexy and surprisingly comfortable.

Once considered too risqué to wear outside the house, slinky little numbers can now be sported at work, weddings, and far beyond. To help you find the perfect one, we’ve highlighted six key types of slip dresses below—though it’s worth making room in your closet for multiple options.

The Keep-Forever LBD

The black slip dress is so classic, fashion editors rank them right alongside white tees and Levi’s 501s. Versatile enough to pair with practically anything, a timeless LBD slip makes a chic complement to trending items like ballerina sneakers, barn jackets, and studded hobo bags. Snag one now from Lunya, Skims, or Leset, so you’ll be ready to style whatever It-pieces the coming seasons bring.

Lunya Washable Silk Slip Dress

Leset Barb Satin Slip Dress

Skims Soft Lounge Long Slip Dress

Norma Kamali Satin Bias Strapless Gown

Now 7% Off

Cou Cou The Cami Slip

The Personality Print

Slip dresses may be defined by their simplicity, but that doesn’t mean they have to be boring. The understated, spaghetti-strap silhouette makes the perfect canvas for a conversation-starting print. Whether Leslie Amon’s chili-peppered LBD or the colorful lemon midi from L’Agence speaks more to your personal style, you’ll find an excuse to show off your new favorite dress again and again.

Leslie Amon Spicy Galli Mini Dress

Hutch Emaline Satin Maxi Slipdress

Now 37% Off

Miaou Helga Dress

Silk Laundry ’90s Slip Dress

L'Agence Akiya Tank Dress

The Wedding Guest Dress

Classically sexy and effortlessly chic, an ankle-skimming slip dress can outsmart any wedding dress code. A change of shoes and accessories completely transforms a look, meaning you can rewear the same dress to a gala or cocktail party happening later in the year. Thankfully, Nili Lotan’s silk charmeuse gown and Meshki’s butter yellow maxi work just as well for garden parties as they do black-tie affairs.

Nili Lotan Cami Silk Charmeuse Gown

Mango Draped Dress With Flower Detail

Meshki Yvette Slip Maxi Dress

Staud Cadence Satin Maxi Dress

Vince Satin Bias Maxi Slip Dress

The Linen Summer Dress

Madewell, Favorite Daughter, and Banana Republic’s linen slip dresses will be among the first items you reach for when temperatures peak and vacation calls. The body-skimming tank silhouette keeps you cool and comfortable, and it pairs effortlessly with flip-flops, raffia bags, shell necklaces, and other beachy accoutrements.

Madewell Scoopneck Linen Midi Dress

Favorite Daughter The Josette Linen Slip Dress

Banana Republic Draped Viscose-Linen Maxi Dress

Reiss Roxanne Linen Slip Dress

J.Crew Lace-Trim Linen Slip Dress

The Lingerie Slip

Lean into the slip’s boudoir origins with a lacy, lingerie-inspired dress that gives you an instant confidence boost. Reformation, Dôen, and LoveShackFancy’s flirty little numbers can slant ’90s grunge or 21st-century boho depending on how they’re styled. They also happen to make excelllent date-night dresses.

Mango Lace Camisole Dress

Reformation Cleodora Dress

Dôen Alissa Dress

Massimo Dutti Satin Camisole Midi Dress

LoveShackFancy Manuela Dress

The Sleek Wardrobe Staple

A neutral-colored slip dress can be a versatile staple in your everyday wardrobe. Éterne, Naadam, and Another Tomorrow’s understated midis and maxis can be layered over a fitted tee or slipped beneath a blazer. And they look just as good with Sambas as they do with chunky fisherman sandals, strappy high heels, and demure ballet flats.

Éterne Maxi Tank Dress

Naadam Baby Rib Slip Dress

Cuyana Crepe De Chine Silk Slip Dress

Aya Muse Jersey Slip Dress
